has a new and efficient high speed service known as
. It is often promoted as an indigenous Korean train, although it is actually based on the French TGV.
Station and terminate in the cities of

. Most major cities are served in between. 

The KTX train is regarded as an easier, more comfortable and cheaper way to get around South Korea than by plane. Ticket prices are slightly below the equivalent airfare.

The KTX service does not connect to any other country, although many Korean would hope that one day it could run through North Korea and onto the rest of the Asian continent.
Note that the promised line from
has been cancelled. KTX services will however be available from
station and beyond in the near future. (December 2013)
Tickets may be purchased up to one month in advance at any Korean Rail station ticket office, or online at
. The online option has the benefit of allowing you to book in English, and tickets can be picked up in advance from any Korean Rail Ticket Office.
